title: Ticket #6522: Remove cedar "internal" and "ASCII" coding methods
description:
Cedar has three serialization formats, "internal", "external", and "ASCII". Condor only uses "external" today. ASCII isn't fully implemented, and I suspect "internal" has been broken for years.

Nonetheless, every cedar read or write checks the current serialization format, switching on the type. This leads to excess confusion for static analyzers, confusion for humans readers of the code, and slows down execution.

We will remove these unsued serialization formats.
check_ins:

2018-Jan-08 09:59   Check-in [53098]: Remove "internal" and "ASCII" cedar serialization methods #6522 This cleans up the code by removing unused code paths (By Greg Thain )
